caption:
This photograph captures a scene at a polluted riverside. In the foreground, there is a body of water where several white geese are swimming. There appears to be a considerable amount of debris and litter floating on the water, including plastic bottles, wrappers, and other unidentified trash. The geese ignore the pollution, with one of them holding a branch in its beak.

The background features dense green foliage, likely indicating a woodland area beyond the riverbank. The overall setting suggests a contrast between natural beauty and environmental neglect. The river itself reflects a calm, yet lamentably trash-filled water surface. The photo seems to convey a message about the impact of human waste on natural habitats.
title: Ducks forage in litter left by visitors to White Rock Lake. Once unspoiled and relatively isolated, White Rock has become a city-dweller's weekend mecca. Many now come here just to be where the action is.
